results.title: African odyssey: the two worlds of Musembe
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Albert Waller
results.brief_description: The two worlds of 11 year-old Musembe are the two worlds of 20th century Africa: the modern city where Musembe and his parents live in a large apartment building, and the primitive village where his civil servant father was born. A journey “home” - back to the family’s village - shows us the natural beauty of Kenya and gives a very human insight into the decisions which confront many Africans today. Musembe feels drawn to the village, and the tribal customs but his father reminds him, “We are city people now”, and we realize the emotional conflicts which come with rapid social change.

results.title: African odyssey: the red bicycle
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Albert Waller
results.brief_description: The travels of a red bicycle, assembled in Nairobi, enable us to learn about economic life in Africa, as it passes to a succession of owners. A tribal chief visiting the city buys it for his son and takes it back to his village in the bush. Subsequently, it is acquired by a young farmer, a government coffee tester, some tourists on safari, and eventually returned to the original village, where its parts are broken up and shared by everyone.

results.title: African music: old and new
results.brief_description: An introduction to traditional African musical instruments such as flutes, rattles, drums and the Mbira. A modern concert is seen, which shows two African musicians using the traditional instruments with modern ones. These include amplified African drums, electric guitar, a wired Mbira and flutes.

results.title: African girl - Malobi
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: The activities of a ten year old West African girl who sells her grandfather’s carvings in the market place so that she can go to school. Shows how the West African procures shelter, food and clothing, recreation and education.

results.title: African continent: an introduction
results.brief_description: An overview of the African continent; relationship between geographic factors; cultures and development of the people of each region; different climates; tropical rain forests, savanna, desert, Mediterranean; mountain ranges; rivers; population; European influence; crops; mineral resources; and progress being made as transportation, roads, machinery and water power development are improved. Problems created by emergence from old to new ways are introduced.

results.title: African city: contrasting cultures
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions, Frank Gardonyi and Clifford Janoff
results.brief_description: Discusses the great contrasts of culture, life style and economic well being in the African city of Abidjan on the Ivory Coast. Shows the two distinct areas which represent the dichotomy between the poor and the wealthy.

results.title: African carving: a Dogon Kanaga mask
results.brief_description: Examines the ceremonies and rituals surrounding the Kanaga mask. Shows the ritual of carving the mask and presents part of the ceremony in which the mask is used to release the spirit of a dead man.
results.description: Examines the ceremonies and rituals surrounding the Kanaga mask. Shows the ritual of carving the mask and presents part of the ceremony in which the mask is used to release the spirit of a dead man.

results.title: African awakening
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and Peter Hopkinson
results.brief_description: Explores the many factors influencing the future of Nigeria, Ghana and Sierra Leone. Shows these young nations adapting their traditiional social ways and cultures to the challenge of our times. Side by side with the traditional, a new Africa is growing and the film is an expression of the attitudes of those African men and women who are today the driving force of West African progress.
